intro: Hydrocotyle javanica, commonly known as the Java spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and can be used in traditional medicine in some cultures. Hydrocotyle javanica is also known for its ability to thrive in wet soil conditions, making it a common sight in swampy areas.
